result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Timothy M Bolte in court.  Attorney Joshua Ryan-Polczinski in court for Timothy M Bolte.  Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Notice to Person Posting Bond Money

Defendant Timothy M Bolte appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Joshua Ryan-Polczinski in court for Timothy M Bolte.  Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin. Not guilty plea entered by counsel. Speedy Trial rights reserved. Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Timothy M Bolte appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Obi Uzowulu for Joshua Ryan-Polczinski in court for Timothy M Bolte.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court. Called @ 1:43 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for initial appearance as to all files - 22CM448, 22CM449 & 22CM450. Record by Atty. Uzowulu as to unavailability of Atty. Ryan-Polczinski and asks that matters be set over for him to appear with the defendant. Matters assigned to Judge Koss and set on his calendar. Court in recess.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

records.addlTxt: Signed bond filed with the court.
Defendant Timothy M Bolte in court, in custody by video. JJ Crawford appeared for the State. Attorney Jason Daane appeared. Minutes filed.

BOND TO COVER 22GF839, 22GF833, & 22GF824

DEFENDANT MUST POST $500 CASH

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH ELKHORN SALOON. NO CONTACT WITH V.J.Y. dob 12-19-1997. NO CONTACT WITH APARTMENTS ON LEWIS ST. IN ELKHORN. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant. 

22-3680,3681; 22-3726 thru 3728; 22-3762 thru 3764
